intro: Argocoffeopsis eketensis, commonly known as the Eket coffee tree, is a tropical plant native to West Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces small, red fruits that contain seeds used for coffee production. It thrives in humid, shaded environments with well-drained soil. Due to its limited distribution and ecological significance, it is considered a valuable species for conservation efforts.
